page.title: 02Alresford - Population (1)
page.content: Over the last 80 years there has been a dramatic rise in Alresford's total population and this figure now stands at 2300. The increase in population was caused by three main factors: firstly ruralisation, which was made possible by greater transport facilities, secondly, a somewhat idealised view of village life and finally, the development of the housing estate and new primary school. The housing estate catered mainly for the London overspill population, especially those from the East-end who brought with them a totally different lifestyle. Today's population can basically be split into 3 groups. Traditionalists consist mainly of older people who have lived in Alresford for many years and these tend to be scattered around the site of the original village.{cont
